intro: Athrixia nyassana, commonly known as the African rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features small, green, succulent leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, helping it conserve water. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, with four petals and are borne on short stalks. Athrixia nyassana is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
